title: Senior Boeing Pilot Told Colleague He Unintentionally Misled Regulators on 737 MAX
text:
A senior Boeing Co. pilot told a colleague he unintentionally misled federal regulators about a key system on the plane maker’s 737 MAX, according to a transcript of instant messages reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

In the exchange, from 2016, Mark Forkner, then Boeing’s chief technical pilot for the MAX, and a colleague named Patrik Gustavsson appeared to be discussing the plane maker’s modification of a flight-control system known as MCAS so that it worked in low-speed situations, with increased power. The messages also...
description: Former chief technical pilot for the MAX wrote, ‘So I basically lied to the regulators (unknowingly),’ referring to the FAA.
